content.1: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh,
content.3: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
content.4: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what
content.6: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
content.8: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
content.9: Lest I be full, and deny
content.10: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
content.16: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth
content.19: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
content.22: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;
content.27: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
content.28: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.
content.31: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom
content.32: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil,
content.33: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
